pull.title: Remove double-dash parameters from mapArgs
pull.body:
If command line parameters contain '--gen' (for example), then
'mapArgs' map will contain both '--gen' and '-gen' after BOOST_FOREACH.
As it is redundant, remove '--gen' from the 'mapArgs' map.

events.body:
I wonder how this interacts with parameters that can be specified multiple
times like --rpcbind/--bind. Does this remove all the occurences?
As the code is built, for '--bind' (for example) parameter mapArgs contains two entries '--bind' and '-bind'. The fix removes the '--bind' entry.
But what if the user already provides -bind= two times? or, both a -bind and --bind?

@kostaz I'd like to suggest an alternative implementation as I don't like the current loop which modifies mapArgs while iterating over it.

You could detect and remove the second '-' already _before_ inserting into mapArgs and mapMultiArgs, here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/util.cpp#L482

Updated.
Double-dash is removed before BOOST_FOREACH.
Please review.

Code changes look good to me.
BTW I think https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/4281 is needed before this, otherwise --help will stop working.

events.message:
Remove double-dash parameters from mapArgs

Should be merged after pull request #4281
("Add `-version` option to get just the version #4281"),
because is changed "--help" to "-help".

Checked that grep of 'mapArgs.count("--' returned only
three places that are fixed by pull request #4281.

events.body:
Totally right.

Should be merged after pull request #4281 ("Add `-version` option to get just the version #4281"),
because is changed "--help" to "-help".

Checked that grep of 'mapArgs.count("--' returned only three places that are fixed by pull request #4281.

It would be much better to use 'boost::program_options' for all parameter stuff, like here:
http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_55_0/doc/html/program_options/tutorial.html

Are there any plans/objections to this massive change in parameter handling?

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/71aaff393f06378150612fc618b6c3f84c1d2066 for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
